title: Citi Recognized as Latin America Bond House of the Year by IFR and LatinFinance Magazines
summary: New York - Citi was named Latin America Bond House of the Year by International Financing Review (IFR) and LatinFinance as part of their 2013 awards. In addition, IFR recognized Citi as Global Emerging Market Bond House of the Year, as well as Global Derivatives House of the Year and Global Credit Derivatives House of the Year.
tag-1: Citi Recognized as Latin America Bond House of the Year by IFR and LatinFinance Magazines
tag-3: New York – Citi was named Latin America Bond House of the Year by International Financing Review (IFR) and LatinFinance as part of their 2013 awards. In addition, IFR recognized Citi as Global Emerging Market Bond House of the Year, as well as Global Derivatives House of the Year and Global Credit Derivatives House of the Year.
tag-4: According to Dealogic, Citi was the No. 1 underwriter of international bonds from Latin America in 2013, and acted as bookrunner on 37.1 percent of the total volume from the region. Citi has unmatched geographical breadth in the region, having led 65 deals from 15 different countries in Latin America.
tag-5: "We are honored to receive this award on behalf of all our clients who entrusted their transactions to Citi. We continuously strive to push the frontier of innovation and creativity in order to serve our clients," said Chris Gilfond, Co-Head of Latin America Capital Markets Origination at Citi.
tag-6: Citi Latin America is uniquely positioned to support fast growing economies expanding in the region or globally. Citi's unparalleled international and regional network, and breadth and depth of product knowledge allow clients to execute business in any part of the world, accessing the knowledge, capacity and experience of Citi's global structure.
tag-7: Citi's has a unique and unmatched footprint in Latin America, serving communities, institutions and nations for more than 130 years. Today, Citi has a presence in 24 countries in the region, meeting the needs of clients through more than 2,400 branches (including joint ventures) and more than 65,000 talented people.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
